yage.resource.mesh

Authors:
Eric Poggel

License:
LGPL

class Mesh;
Models are divided into one or more meshes. Each mesh has its own material and an array of triangle indices. The triangle indicices index into an array of vertices in a parent Model.

this();


this(Mesh mesh);
Create as an exact duplicate of another Mesh.

this(Material matl, Vec!(int,3) [] triangles);
Create with a material and triangles.

bool getCached();
Are the triangles of this mesh cashed in video memory?

Vec!(int,3) [] getTriangles();
Get the array of triangle indices that define this Mesh.

uint getTrianglesVBO();
Get the OpenGL Vertex Buffer Object index for the triangles indices.

Material getMaterial();
Get the Material assigned to this Mesh.

void setMaterial(Material matl);
void setMaterial(char[] filename);
Set the Material of this Mesh.

void setTriangles(Vec!(int,3) [] triangles);
Set the triangles of this mesh. Each triangle contains three vertex indicies from the vertex arrays in the containing Model.

char[] toString();
Return a string representation of this Mesh and its data.
